name: flaskinventoryapp
title: Flask Inventory App
desc: A lightweight Flask web app to manage store inventory with CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionality. Built with Flask and SQLite for efficient local database management.
longDesc: This project is a small but complete inventory management system built with Flask. It supports creating, editing, deleting and listing products, with validation and SQLite as the backing database. I built it to learn how to structure a Flask app with blueprints and ORM models, and to practice thinking about data flows from the database up to the UI.
highlights: Full CRUD for products (create, read, update, delete)
Uses SQLAlchemy models and migrations
Search and filter inventory records
Clear separation between routes, templates and models
learning: Structuring a Flask project for growth
Designing RESTful routes for basic resources
Working with SQLite and SQLAlchemy relationships

name: playwright-auto-checker
title: Automated Stock Checker + Add to Cart
desc: A Python automation tool that monitors product stock on e-commerce sites using Playwright. Sends real-time SMS alerts when selected products become available, with optional auto-add-to-cart functionality.
longDesc: A Playwright-powered script that opens product pages, checks availability and can auto-add items to the basket. It sends SMS notifications with Twilio when stock appears, so you don't have to refresh pages manually.
highlights: Headless stock checking using Playwright
Config-driven list of products to monitor
Optional auto-add-to-cart behaviour
Twilio SMS alerts with product details
learning: Keeping secrets safe with environment variables

name: django_project
title: Django Blog
desc: A Django project featuring user registration, authentication, and full CRUD functionality for blog posts. Includes two main apps ‚Äî Blog and Users ‚Äî and uses Crispy Forms with Bootstrap 4 for clean, responsive UI.

name: tic-tac-toe-minimax-ai
title: Tic-tac-Toe Minimax AI
desc: A tic-tac-toe game featuring an AI opponent powered by the Minimax algorithm, recursively analysing each move to achieve perfect play. Background music is handled via a lightweight miniaudio wrapper.
highlights: Unbeatable AI using the minimax decision algorithm
Recursive game tree evaluation with terminal state scoring
Modular architecture separating game logic, AI, and audio
Integrated audio playback via a custom miniaudio wrapper

name: react-fake-os
title: React Fake OS Website
desc: A web-based fake operating system built with React, featuring desktop-style window management, interactive applications, and a retro-inspired UI.
highlights: Modular component-based architecture for windows and applications
Fully Functional Music Player
Fake terminal application with interactive command-style input
Dynamic project data loaded from external JSON
learning: Designing reusable React components for complex interactive UIs
Managing application and window state across multiple components
Separating data from presentation using external JSON sources
Planning extensible frontend architecture with future backend support

name: block-craft
title: Block Craft
desc: A simple Minecraft-inspired sandbox game built in Python using the Ursina engine, featuring block placement, destruction, and first-person movement.
longDesc: Block Craft is a small sandbox-style game inspired by Minecraft, developed in Python using the Ursina game engine. The project focuses on core gameplay mechanics such as first-person movement, block placement and removal, and basic world interaction. It was created as a learning exercise to explore 3D game development, real-time input handling, and structuring a larger Python project beyond small scripts.
highlights: First-person player movement with keyboard and mouse controls
Place and destroy blocks in a 3D world
Simple block selection system
Real-time interaction using a Python-based game engine
learning: Using a 3D game engine and understanding scene graphs
Handling real-time input and player controls
Debugging and iterating on interactive systems

name: image-classifier-gui
title: Image Classifier GUI
desc: A desktop GUI application that classifies images using a trained machine learning model, built to explore the basics of computer vision and model integration.
longDesc: Image Classifier GUI is a Python desktop application that allows users to load an image and classify it using a pre-trained machine learning model. The project was created to better understand how machine learning models can be integrated into user-facing applications, focusing on model loading, inference, and basic GUI design rather than model training itself.
highlights: Graphical user interface for selecting and classifying images
Integration of a pre-trained machine learning model
Displays predicted class output to the user
Simple, user-friendly desktop workflow
learning: Integrating machine learning models into applications
Separating application logic from interface code
